result.execSummary:
The defendant Mariah K. Alt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time employment and/or schooling.

Submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling, treatment, evaluation per agent.  Random urinalysis.  Absolute sobriety as to alcohol and controlled substances unless valid Rx.  Report Rx to agent within 2 working days.  No entry into taverns, liquor stores or where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol on a social basis.  Entry allowed for employment purposes, per agent.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Jail to commence on or before August 2, 2014.  Two (2) days credit if revoked.
Consecutive to: any other sentences or commitments.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mariah K. Alt in court with attorney Paul F.X. Schwartz.  Defendant Mariah K. Alt in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case parties state appearances.  Parties will argue sentence after revocation.  Atty Schwartz notes they rec'd revocation summary and there are no corrections to be made.  State makes recommendations.  Atty Schwartz makes recommendations.  DE makes statement on her own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.

Ct 1 ONLY:
4 years prison (1 1/2 years initial confinement and 2 1/2 years extended supervision)
Conditions of extended supervision:
All probation continue as conditions of extended supervision
DE is eligible for CIP and ERP
401 days sentence credit to be applied
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 9, 2017 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mariah K. Alt in court with attorney Paul F Schwartz.  John A Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties have reviewed the PSI and ready to proceed.  State reached an agreement.   Attorney Schwartz request employment for waitressing and also request DNA surcharges be waived.  Defendant makes statement.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1 & 2:
48 months Probation, concurrent
One DNA surcharge $250/submit sample
6 months Sauk Co. jail, with Huber on Count 1.  2 days credit if revoked.  Jail to commence on or before August 2, 2014 at 6:30 p.m.
Undergo any counseling, treatment, evaluation per agent.

No entry into taverns or where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol on a social basis.  Entry allowed for employment purposes, per agent.

Defendant Mariah K. Alt in court with attorney Paul F Schwartz.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea entered to Cts. 1 & 2, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court  orders PSI.  Report to be back by June 6, 2014

Atty. Schwartz to get date in Br. 2.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
